name: UPhysicsSpringComponent
doc:
Note: this component is still work in progress. Uses raycast springs for simple vehicle forces
   Used with objects that have physics to create a spring down the X direction
   ie. point X in the direction you want generate spring.

SpringStiffness: Specifies how much strength the spring has. The higher the SpringStiffness the more force the spring can push on a body with.
SpringDamping: Specifies how quickly the spring can absorb energy of a body. The higher the damping the less oscillation
SpringLengthAtRest: Determines how long the spring will be along the X-axis at rest. The spring will apply 0 force on a body when it's at rest.
SpringRadius: Determines the radius of the spring.
SpringChannel: Strength of thrust force applied to the base object.
bIgnoreSelf: If true, the spring will ignore all components in its own actor
SpringCompression: The current compression of the spring. A spring at rest will have SpringCompression 0.

methods.name: GetNormalizedCompressionScalar
methods.doc:
Returns the spring compression as a normalized scalar along spring direction.
0 implies spring is at rest
1 implies fully compressed

methods.name: GetSpringCurrentEndPoint
methods.doc: Returns the spring current end point in world space.

methods.name: GetSpringDirection
methods.doc: Returns the spring direction from start to resting point

methods.name: GetSpringRestingPoint
methods.doc: Returns the spring resting point in world space.
